text: I have a multilanguage site and put in a link from one of the languages towards another one. Basically the English one is default and has Swedish and Norwegian clones, but when I put in a link towards /no/ in the /sv/ page, it replaces /no/ to /sv/? "Enable Language Specific Redirects" are turned off, but that shouldn't matter anyway, right?
This is the same field, rendered as href = replacing the lang slug, rendered as text = correct
It would be nice if H tags didn’t autocomplete to a new line.

This is how I like my headline code:
```<h3 class="discrete-table-title">Discrete 12-month Performance</h3>```

But it autocompletes like:
```
<h3 class="discrete-table-title">
    Discrete 12-month Performance
</h3>
```
I’m not sure if other people do it like that but it scares me with inline tags
Even though H tags aren’t inline
i think inline tags stay on the same line
The text floating out there in the middle of nowhere scares me.
